appendix.title: Fixnum
appendix.para: FixnumFixnum#%number Returns the result of the receiver modulo number. Aliased by Fixnum#modulo.
IntegerFixnum#&number Returns the result of a bitwise AND between the receiver and number.
NumericFixnum#*number Returns the result of multiplying number with the receiver.
NumericFixnum#**number Returns the result of raising the receiver to the numberth power.
NumericFixnum#+number Returns the result of adding the receiver to number.
NumericFixnum#-number Returns the result of subtracting number from the receiver.
FixnumFixnum#-@ Returns the receiver with a negative sign.
IntegerFixnum#/number Returns the result of dividing—using integer division—the receiver by number. Aliased by Fixnum#div.
true or falseFixnum#<number Returns true if the receiver is less than number; otherwise, false.
IntegerFixnum#<<number Returns the result of left-shifting number bits of the receiver.
true or falseFixnum#<=number Returns true if the receiver is less than or equal to number; otherwise, false.
-1, 0, 1Fixnum#<=>number Returns -1 if the receiver is less than number, 0 if they are equal, and 1 if it is greater.
true or falseFixnum#==number Returns true if the number is a Numeric with the same value as the receiver; false, otherwise. Aliased by Fixnum#===.
true or falseFixnum#===number Aliases Fixnum#==.
IntegerFixnum#>>number Returns the result of right-shifting number bits of the receiver and its sign.
0 or 1Fixnum#[]bit Returns the bitth bit of the receiver, where the 0th bit is the least significant.
IntegerFixnum#^number Returns the result of a bitwise EXCLUSIVE OR between the receiver and number.
FixnumFixnum#abs Returns the absolute value of the receiver. Aliased by Fixnum#magnitude.
FixnumFixnum#divnumber Aliases Fixnum#/.
true or falseFixnum#even? Returns true if this number is even; otherwise, false.
true or falseFixnum#eql?number Returns true if number is a Fixnum with the same value as the receiver; false, otherwise.
ArrayFixnum#divmodnumber Divides the receiver by number, returning an Array whose first element is the quotient, and last element, the modulus. The quotient is rounded toward −∞.
FloatFixnum#fdivnumber Returns the result of dividing—using floating-point division—the receiver by number. Aliased by Fixnum#quo.
FixnumFixnum#magnitude Aliases Fixnum#abs.
NumericFixnum#modulonumber Aliases Fixnum#%.
true or falseFixnum#odd? Returns true if this number is odd; otherwise, false.
FixnumFixnum#size Returns the number of bytes used to represent the receiver.
IntegerFixnum#succ Returns the receiver incremented by 1.
FloatFixnum#to_f Converts the receiver to a Float.
StringFixnum#to_sbase=10 Returns a String representation of the receiver in the given base, where base is between 2 and 36 inclusive.
true or falseFixnum#zero? Returns true if the receiver is equal to zero; otherwise, false.
IntegerFixnum#|number Returns the result of a bitwise OR between the receiver and number.
IntegerFixnum#~ Returns the result of inverting the receiver’s bits.
